IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: support the university of south carolina in all of its educational, instructional, scientific, literary, research, service, charitable and outreach endeavors.
IRS990.MissionDescription: SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA in all of its educational, instructional, scientific, literary, research, service, charitable and outreach endeavors.
IRS990.Description: BENEFIT/SUPPORT THRoUgh ESTABLISHMENT/IMPLEMENTATION OF LONG- RANGE FUNDRAISING PROGRAMS TO ASSIST IN THE EXPANSION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE EDUCATIONAL FUNCTIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY

OtherAssets.Description: ASSETS HELD IN TRUST BY OTHERS
ASSETS HELD IN TRUST BY FNDTN

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The net income of the foundation's endowment funds is utilized as directed by the board of directors of the foundation in accordance with established priorities and gift restrictions for the exclusive benefit of the university of south carolina. these uses include but are not limited to: 1) scholarships and/or fellowships 2) chairs and/or professorships 3) general program support for various university departments, college, institutes, and offices
Changes in pledges receivable 4,598,306 Annuity Adjustment 160,955
Changes in Pledges Receivable 4,598,306 Special Events 59,387

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: For scholarships, the university of south carolina is provided with the award requirements for each scholarship. they then provide us with the name of each scholarship recipient. For colon screenings, the recipient must maintain accurate records of activities and expenditures and provide a written report of outcomes, activities, lessons learned and any issues/questions arising from the screenings.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION PROVIDED DR. ODOM WITH A DISCRETIONARY ACCOUNT IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,000. IT WAS USED TO PAY EXPENSES TOTALING $1,334, THE BALANCE WAS RETURNED.

RUSSELL H. MEEKINS AND KIMBERLY H. ELLIOTT RECEIVED THEIR COMPENSATION FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA, AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION. MR. MEEKINS RECEIVED A TOTAL OF $167,844 FROM USC. MRS. ELLIOTT RECEIVED A TOTAL OF $129,503 FROM USC. THE FOUNDATION REIMBURSED THE UNIVERSITY 100% OF THESE COSTS.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the 990 is emailed to each board member prior to filing. board members are requested to review the form and notify the foundation prior to the form due date if they have any comments or corrections to the form.
The foundation makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public through the foundation's website AND UPON REQUEST.

The foundation's Conflict of interest policy is distributed annually to board members at a full board meeting. attached to the copy of the conflict of interest policy is a signature form for each board member to sign and indicate that they have read, and complied with, the foundation's conflict of interest policy for the year. the signature forms are collected and kept by the foundation.

The executive officer's compensation is determined based on performance and board reviews. the salary is derived from comparable industry data and achievement of performance standards established at the beginning of each fiscal year.

RUFFALOCODY, INC. - THE FOUNDATION PAID RUFFALOCODY, INC., A TOTAL OF $542,624. THIS CONSISTED OF $524,219 FOR PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING SERVICES AND $18,405 FOR FUNDRAISING EXPENSES (PRINTING, POSTAGE, ETC.). FUNDRAISING EXPENSES WERE ITEMIZED SEPARATELY FROM THE PROFESSIONAL SERVICE FEES ON THE INVOICES PROVIDED BY RUFFALOCODY. GRENZEBACH, GLIER, & ASSOCIATES, INC. - THE FOUNDATION PAID GRENZEBACH, GLIER, & ASSOCIATES, INC., A TOTAL OF $298,846. THIS CONSISTED OF $277,848 FOR PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING SERVICES AND $20,998 FOR FUNDRAISING EXPENSES (FOOD, TRAVEL, ETC.) GRENZEBACH WAS REQUIRED TO TRACK EXPENSES SEPARATELY FROM PROFESSIONAL FEES AND PROVIDE AN ITEMIZED, DETAILED INVOICE.

SOUTH FINANCIAL GROUP, INC. - DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2009, A FOUNDATION BOARD MEMBER SERVED ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR SOUTH FINANCIAL GROUP, INC. - THE PARENT COMPANY OF THE BANK WITH WHICH THE FOUNDATION MAINTAINED ITS PRIMARY CHECKING ACCOUNT(FEES OF $6,700). IN ADDITION, THIS BANK ALSO MADE A LOAN TO A JOINT VENTURE INVOLVING A RELATED ORGANIZATION (THE USC DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION) AND USC HOTEL INVESTMENTS, LLC. ANOTHER CURRENT MEMBER OF THE FOUNDATION BOARD HAS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN USC HOTEL INVESTMENTS, LLC. THE LOAN RESULTED IN INTEREST EXPENSE OF $572,384. ALL TRANSACTIONS WERE CONDUCTED IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF PRUDENT BUSINESS WITHOUT INFLUENCE FROM THE DIRECTOR. USC HOTEL INVESTMENTS, LLC - A CURRENT FOUNDATION MEMBER HAS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN USC HOTEL INVESTMENTS, LLC. THIS ENTITY IS INVOLVED IN A JOINT VENTURE WITH A RELATED ORGANIZATION (THE USC DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION). THE USC DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION INVESTED $2,020,000 AND OWNS 80% OF THE JOINT VENTURE WHILE USC HOTEL INVESTMENTS, LLC, OWNS 20%. ALL TRANSACTIONS WERE CONDUCTED IN THE NORMAL COURSE OF PRUDENT BUSINESS WITHOUT INFLUENCE FROM THE DIRECTOR.
